properties.name: Annotation Node
properties.data: Arguably most of these events led to the themes of inevitable death due to the uncontrollable forces of nature in Quiroga’ s work

properties.name: Annotation Node
properties.data: Another story that has nature take a prominent role in the story is “Plague of Ants” by Fray Bartolomé de las Casas

properties.name: Annotation Node
properties.data: Similarly , the Spanish face nature’s wrath through a plague of ants which destroy the cassia trees that they try to plant

properties.name: Annotation Node
properties.data: In other stories we have read, nature is simply an obstacle and does not have a major effect on the plot of the story

properties.name: Annotation Node
properties.data: Unlike “The Decapitated Chicken” or “The Plague of Ants”, nature plays a passive role, and the main character can overcome his circumstances

properties.name: Annotation Node
properties.data: Lastly, in the story “The Death of the Empress of China”, nature does not affect the progression of the story and it is not an obstacle for the characters

properties.name: Annotation Node
properties.data: Instead, nature is seen in a much more positive light - a setting filled with joy and elegance

properties.name: Annotation Node
properties.data: From the stories we have read, nature plays a variety of different roles

properties.name: Annotation Node
properties.data: In some stories, nature plays a key role by being an uncontrollable force that often leads to undesirable outcomes for the characters in the story whereas in other stories nature is simply the setting of the story

properties.name: Annotation Node
properties.data: The idea of nature is present in all the stories we have read so far in some form; however , its role is unique in each

properties.name: Annotation Node
properties.data: Of the stories we’ve read so far, “The Decapitated Chicken”, which depicts the events of a husband, wife, and their four severely mentally disabled sons, nature plays the largest role in affecting the plot

properties.name: Annotation Node
properties.data: Nature plays an active role by causing the sons’ conditions to be completely out of the parents' control, however , the parents begin to blame each other instead

properties.name: Annotation Node
properties.data: The parents assumed that the conditions of their sons were preventable and did not contemplate the idea that it was an inevitable force of nature

properties.name: Annotation Node
properties.data: Similar to the sons’ conditions, nature is in control when determining the fate of the daughter without any control from the parents

properties.name: Annotation Node
properties.data: It can be argued that in this story, the main character is nature itself since it is the driving force of the plot whereas the family had little control of what happened and were simply reactions to nature’s actions

properties.name: Annotation Node
properties.data: This story provides a more realistic view of life and Weiland 3 Overall, nature takes on a variety of roles in the stories we have read, whether it be an unstoppable force against the characters, an obstacle to overcome, or simply just the setting of the story. 2
